title: Filmmaker Shyam Benegal passes away at the age of 90 - The Times of India
Oyo buys US-based G6 Hospitality from Blackstone for $525 mn, adds 1,500 hotels - Mint
summary:
Oyo buys US-based G6 Hospitality from Blackstone for $525 mn, adds 1,500 hotels

Date: Recent publication
Source: Live Mint

Oyo has completed the acquisition of G6 Hospitality, known for its Motel 6 and Studio 6 brands, from Blackstone for $525 million. This deal is expected to significantly expand Oyo's presence in North America.

The acquisition aims to enhance Oyo's profitability, projecting an Ebitda of over ₹2,000 crore by FY26. Motel 6 is expected to contribute significantly to this goal in the upcoming financial year. Oyo will be adding about 1,500 franchised hotels across the US and Canada, with a combined booking value reaching approximately $3 billion.

  • Oyo's acquisition is worth $525 million.
  • The deal adds 1,500 hotels to Oyo's portfolio.
  • Integration of Motel 6 is expected to deliver ₹630 crore in Ebitda.
  • The acquisition aligns with Oyo’s strategy for robust growth in the US market.
  • Sonal Sinha appointed as CEO of G6 Hospitality.
“This acquisition represents a transformative moment for Oyo's global operations. We could see this will be a value-accretive acquisition due to their strong brand franchise in the US, potential for growth and synergies.” - Ankit Tandon, Oyo

This strategic move not only enhances Oyo's market position but also marks a significant step in its expansion plans across North America.
newTitle: Oyo Acquires G6 Hospitality for $525 Million, Expanding U.S. Presence

"Clots In Brain": On Vinod Kambli's Urgent Hospitalisation, Doctor Gives Worrying Details - NDTV Sports
summary:
Vinod Kambli Hospitalized Due to Brain Clots: Doctor Provides Update

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Vinod Kambli, the former India cricketer, has been hospitalized with brain clots following initial complaints of a urinary infection. Doctors have reported that his condition remains critical but stable.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akruti Hospital in Thane after experiencing urinary issues and cramps.
  • Medical examinations revealed clots in his brain; ongoing monitoring and further tests are scheduled.
  • Dr. Vivek Trivedi stated that Kambli's health is being closely observed.
  • Life-long free treatment has been pledged by the hospital in-charge, S Singh.
  • Kambli's recent health struggles have gained public attention, particularly due to viral videos showing his condition.
Kambli said, "I am better now. My wife takes care of me a lot... My son picked me up and brought me back to my feet."

The situation remains serious as doctors continue to monitor Kambli's health, and further updates are anticipated.
newTitle: Vinod Kambli Hospitalized Due to Brain Clots: Doctor Provides Update

title: PM Modi Attends Christmas Programme Hosted By Catholic Bishops Conference Of India - News18
summary:
PM Modi Condemns Violence and Promotes Harmony During Christmas Address

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a Christmas event hosted by the Catholic Bishops’ Conference of India, condemning attempts to incite violence and emphasizing the teachings of love and brotherhood from Jesus Christ.

  • Modi vowed to strengthen the spirit of love as emphasized in Christian teachings.
  • Condemned a recent terror attack in Germany that resulted in multiple casualties.
  • Highlighted India's humanitarian efforts during the COVID-19 pandemic.
  • Stressed the importance of bringing back Indian citizens trapped in crises, including war-torn regions.
  • Celebrated the elevation of George Koovakad as a Cardinal by Pope Francis.
  • Invited Pope Francis to visit India, marking a significant diplomatic gesture.
“The Bible says – bear each other’s burdens. Our institutions and organisations work with this motto.” - PM Modi

PM Modi’s address reinforced India's dedication to humanitarian values and interfaith harmony, marking a significant moment in the country's cultural and diplomatic landscape during the Christmas season.
newTitle: PM Modi Condemns Violence and Promotes Harmony During Christmas Address

Former Supreme Court Justice V Ramasubramanian appointed NHRC Chairperson - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Former Supreme Court Justice V Ramasubramanian appointed NHRC Chairperson

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

The appointment has been made consequent upon the retirement of Justice Arun Mishra from the post on June 1. NHRC member Vijayabharathi Sayani was serving as the acting chairperson in the interregnum.

Key Points:

  • Justice Ramasubramanian completed his law degree from Madras Law College.
  • He was appointed as an additional judge of the Madras High Court in 2006.
  • He served as Chief Justice of Himachal Pradesh High Court before his Supreme Court appointment.
  • He demitted office from the Supreme Court on June 29, 2023.
“Justice Ramasubramanian’s appointment marks a significant transition for the NHRC.”

This appointment signifies a continuation of experienced leadership within the NHRC following a notable retirement.

title: Former Supreme Court judge V. Ramasubramanian appointed NHRC chairman - The Hindu
summary:
Justice V. Ramasubramanian appointed as NHRC Chairman

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 Source: The Hindu

President Droupadi Murmu has appointed retired Supreme Court Judge Justice V. Ramasubramanian as the Chairman of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) from Tamil Nadu.

  • Justice Ramasubramanian was appointed on December 23, 2024.
  • He was a judge of the Supreme Court of India from September 2019.
  • The NHRC chairpost has been vacant since Justice Arun Kumar Mishra's term ended on June 1, 2024.
  • A high-power committee led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi selected him for the position.
  • Prior to this, he served as Chief Justice of Himachal Pradesh High Court.
"The post of NHRC chairperson has been lying vacant since Justice (retired) Arun Kumar Mishra completed his tenure on June 1."

This appointment brings a highly experienced and scholarly individual to lead the NHRC, which has been missing leadership for several months.
newTitle: Justice V. Ramasubramanian appointed as NHRC Chairman

title: All Thyrocare labs are now NABL accredited - Medical Buyer
Ex-Supreme Court judge V Ramasubramanian appointed NHRC chief - The Times of India
summary:
V Ramasubramanian appointed as new NHRC chief

Publication Date: December 18, 2023 Source: Times of India

The former Supreme Court judge, V Ramasubramanian, has been appointed as the ninth chairperson of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) of India. This position had been vacant since June 2023.

  • V Ramasubramanian served as a Supreme Court judge from 2019 to 2023.
  • He was previously the Chief Justice of Himachal Pradesh high court.
  • He became the first judge to hold a hearing over Skype.
  • He advocated for the decriminalization of defamation and supported freedom of expression.
  • His appointment follows a high-powered committee meeting led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
"This is untrue. Presently, I am enjoying my retired life." - DY Chandrachud, former Chief Justice of India.

The appointment of V Ramasubramanian as NHRC chief highlights a significant transition in India's human rights protection landscape following a vacancy of several months.
newTitle: V Ramasubramanian appointed as new NHRC chief

title: WhatsApp may stop working on these Android smartphones starting next week - The Times of India
summary:
WhatsApp may stop working on these Android smartphones starting next week

Publication Date: January 1, 2025, Source: Times of India

WhatsApp is set to discontinue support for Android devices running on KitKat or older versions starting January 1, 2025, as part of a move by Meta to ensure app security and functionality.

  • The change affects several older smartphones from brands like Samsung, Motorola, HTC, LG, and Sony.
  • Key outdated models include Galaxy S3, Galaxy Note 2, Moto G (1st Gen), and iPhone models such as iPhone 5s.
  • Meta has a history of discontinuing support for older operating systems to maintain compatibility and security standards.
  • Users are advised to upgrade to newer Android versions to continue accessing WhatsApp.
“This update will mainly affect users of older iPhones, specifically the iPhone 5s, iPhone 6, and iPhone 6 Plus, which are limited to iOS 12.5.7.”

In summary, this move emphasizes the necessity for users to stay updated with their devices to ensure continuous access to WhatsApp services.
newTitle: WhatsApp to Discontinue Support for Older Android Smartphones

title: Shami ruled out of remaining two Border-Gavaskar Trophy Tests - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Mohammed Shami Ruled Out of Remaining Two Tests in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Indian cricketer Mohammed Shami has been ruled out of the fourth and fifth Tests in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy due to swelling in his left knee, as per a BCCI press release.

  • Shami recently played for Bengal and had a busy schedule leading up to the Tests.
  • His knee swelling is attributed to increased workload from recent bowling activities.
  • The BCCI medical team recommends more time for recovery before he can return to play.
“The swelling is on the expected lines, owing to the increased bowling after a prolonged period.”

Shami has been recovering from a heel injury and will continue strength and conditioning work. His participation in the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy will depend on his knee condition.
newTitle: Mohammed Shami Ruled Out of Remaining Two Tests in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

title: Jaishankar to begin 6-day visit to US from December 24 - The Times of India
summary:
Jaishankar to Begin 6-Day Visit to US from December 24

Date: December 24-29, 2023

Source: Times of India

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is set to embark on a significant six-day official visit to the United States starting from December 24, marking a key diplomatic engagement post the US presidential elections.

  • Jaishankar will focus on discussing crucial bilateral, regional, and global issues.
  • He will preside over a conference with India's Consul Generals in the US.
  • This visit follows Jaishankar's earlier trip to the US in September.
S Jaishankar is the first high-ranking Indian official to visit the US after Donald Trump's election victory.

This upcoming visit is pivotal in strengthening Indo-US relations amid the ongoing political transitions in the United States.
newTitle: Jaishankar to Begin 6-Day Visit to US from December 24

title: Joe Biden commutes death sentences of 37 including child killers, mass murderers: Full list - The Times of India
summary:
Biden Commutes Death Sentences for 37 Individuals, Including Murderers

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Times of India

President Joe Biden has commuted the death sentences of 37 individuals, including five child killers and several mass murderers. Biden emphasized that his decision is based on a belief that the death penalty should be abolished at a federal level.

  • 37 out of 40 men had their sentences commuted.
  • Among those pardoned are numerous convicted for serious crimes, including child murder.
  • Biden still condemns the crimes committed by the individuals but believes halting the death penalty is necessary.
  • Three notable individuals—Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, Robert Bowers, and Dylann Roof—did not receive commutations.
“Make no mistake: I condemn these murderers, grieve for the victims of their despicable acts, and ache for all the families who have suffered unimaginable and irreparable loss,” Biden stated.

The commutations come as part of a broader trend in Biden's administration towards criminal justice reform and are significant in the dialogue surrounding the death penalty in the United States.
newTitle: Biden Commutes Death Sentences for 37 Individuals, Including Murderers

title: Who is Tanush Kotian? R Ashwin's replacement for India vs Australia series - The Times of India
Ravichandran Ashwin's Replacement In India's Border Gavaskar Trophy Squad Named. Not Axar Patel Or Y.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
Ravichandran Ashwin's Replacement In India's Border Gavaskar Trophy Squad Named

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team has selected young Mumbai off-spinner Tanush Kotian to replace Ravichandran Ashwin, who announced his retirement following the third Test in Brisbane.

  • Tanush Kotian has played 33 First Class matches, taking 101 wickets.
  • Kotian has been included as a precautionary measure and will travel to Australia.
  • Originally, Axar Patel was considered for the replacement but opted out due to personal reasons.
  • Ashwin retired as India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket.
"I made myself a promise in 2012, we lost a tricky series against England. I was very early in my career and I was just telling myself we are not gonna lose another one. Ever. And that is what I promised myself," said Ashwin.

The addition of Kotian underscores the Indian team's strategy to maintain squad strength following Ashwin's retirement.
newTitle: Ravichandran Ashwin's Replacement In India's Border Gavaskar Trophy Squad Named

Pushpa 2 has taken the box office by storm, emerging as the fourth highest-grossing Hindi film ever, surpassing major hits like Bajrangi Bhaijaan and Animal in just 18 days.

  • The film has grossed 932.15 crore worldwide.
  • It earned 692.50 crore net in India.
  • It is expected to join the 1000 crore club soon.

This monumental success highlights the film's widespread appeal and strong performance in the Hindi market.

Date: Publication date not specified Source: Times of India

The article covers the intensifying political conflict between BRS and Congress following vandalism at Telugu actor Allu Arjun's house, where protesters demanded compensation after a stampede linked to the actor's film.

  • Vandalism occurred at Allu Arjun’s residence by a group claiming ties to Osmania University Joint Action Committee.
  • Protesters seek Rs 1 crore for the family of a woman who died during a stampede at a film screening.
  • Six individuals were arrested for the vandalism and granted bail.
  • BJP and BRS criticize Congress over governance and law and order issues.
  • Chief minister condemns the incident and calls for strict law enforcement.
“Attacks on film personalities or anyone are unacceptable.” - Chief Minister Revanth Reddy

This incident reflects growing tensions in the political landscape and the film industry in Telangana, with significant public and political discourse likely to follow.

South Korea says it detects signs of North Korea preparing more troops, drones for Russia - Reuters
summary:
South Korea Detects North Korea Preparing Troops and Drones for Russia

Date: December 23, 2023 | Source: Reuters

South Korea's military reports detecting signs of North Korea sending more troops and weaponry to Russia to bolster its efforts in the Ukraine conflict.

  • North Korea has already delivered military equipment including multiple rocket launchers and self-propelled howitzers to Russia.
  • Preparation for suicide drone production has been noted following a recent test ordered by Kim Jong Un.
  • Estimates suggest around 12,000 North Korean troops are currently in Russia, with significant casualties reported.
  • Increased military collaboration between North Korea and Russia poses a threat to South Korea, possibly enhancing North Korea's military capabilities.
  • South Korea's leadership emphasizes the need for a strong joint security posture with the U.S. amid escalating tensions.
"With the backing of Russia, they'll likely try to stage various strategic provocations next year, such as launching intercontinental ballistic missiles and conducting a nuclear test..." - JCS Official

This development highlights the deteriorating security situation and the potential for further escalations in the region, prompting vigilance from South Korea and its allies.
newTitle: South Korea Detects North Korea Preparing Troops and Drones for Russia

title: Advanced therapies for retinal vascular diseases - Ophthalmology Times
summary:
Advanced Therapies for Retinal Vascular Diseases

Publication Date: Not specified; Source: Ophthalmology Times

A panel of retina specialists discussed highlights from a recent Ophthalmology Times Grand Rounds event, focusing on advanced therapies for retinal vascular diseases like AMD, DME, and CRVO. They emphasized therapy durability and treatment management.

  • Discussion included the use of faricimab for various retinal conditions.
  • Case 1 highlighted improved vision in AMD patients with faricimab treatment.
  • Case 2 demonstrated faricimab's superiority over ranibizumab in treating DME.
  • Case 3 showed positive outcomes with faricimab for persistent CRVO.
  • Case 4 indicated faricimab's effectiveness in neovascular AMD with PED.
“This patient had rapid resolution of fluid with treatment durability and a low number of treatments,” commented Dr. Lally.

The advancements in these therapies indicate a shift towards more effective treatments with less burden for patients suffering from retinal vascular diseases.
newTitle: Advanced Therapies for Retinal Vascular Diseases

Trump says there are only two genders; plans to remove transgender out of the military - The Hindu
summary:
Trump says there are only two genders; plans to remove transgender out of the military

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

President-elect Donald Trump declared his intention to significantly alter transgender policy in the military and public education upon his inauguration, reflecting a broader Republican agenda.

  • Trump pledged on day one to end what he refers to as "transgender lunacy".
  • He plans to remove transgender individuals from military service.
  • Trump aims to restrict gender discussions in schools, stating the government will recognize only two genders.
  • During his speech, he criticized the previous administration’s handling of various issues.
  • The President-elect promised aggressive measures against drug cartels and immigration issues.
"On January 20, the United States will turn the page forever on four long, horrible years of failure, incompetence, national decline." - Donald Trump

The proposed changes signal a continuation of contentious debates over gender and transgender rights in the U.S., which have polarized public opinion.
newTitle: Trump Advocates for Traditional Gender Roles and Military Policy Changes

title: AIIMS, Delhi developing low cost adaptive cellular therapy for treatment of multiple myeloma - The Hindu
summary:
AIIMS, Delhi developing low cost adaptive cellular therapy for treatment of multiple myeloma

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Doctors at AIIMS, Delhi are developing a low-cost antibody-based therapy for multiple myeloma, a type of blood cancer. This innovative approach aims to make advanced CAR-T cell therapies more accessible and affordable in India.

  • The therapy targets B-cell maturation antigen (BCMA) to specifically eliminate multiple myeloma cells.
  • Animal trials have shown promising results, with plans for phase-1 human clinical trials on the horizon.
  • The goal is to significantly reduce the costs associated with existing CAR-T cell therapies.
“CAR-T cell therapies have changed the way we approach and treat cancer. Development of CAR-T cell therapy has been in a nascent state in India despite the rapid pace at which it is moving around the world.” - Dr. Mayank Singh

This development is significant as it seeks to provide a more viable treatment option for many patients in India, addressing both cost and accessibility challenges.
newTitle: AIIMS, Delhi Develops Affordable Treatment for Multiple Myeloma Using Adaptive Cellular Therapy

title: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe to make history with unprecedented flyby of the Sun’s corona on Christmas eve D - The Times of India
summary:
NASA’s Parker Solar Probe to Make Historic Flyby of the Sun’s Corona on Christmas Eve

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Times of India

The Parker Solar Probe is set to achieve a historic milestone by flying through the Sun's corona on December 24, 2024, at a record distance of 3.8 million miles from the Sun’s surface. This flyby marks the 22nd close approach of the spacecraft, launched in 2018, aimed at studying the Sun's inner workings and the mysterious discrepancy in temperatures between its surface and corona.

  • The Parker Solar Probe will measure magnetic fields and charged particles in the Sun's outer atmosphere.
  • It travels at speeds of 430,000 miles per hour, making it the fastest man-made object.
  • The probe is equipped with a specialized heat shield capable of withstanding temperatures as high as 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit.
  • The closest approach will occur at 6:53 a.m. EST on December 24.
  • Data collected will provide insights into solar flares, coronal mass ejections, and their impact on space weather.
“This historic flyby will help reveal the secrets of the Sun, allowing us to protect our technology from solar disruptions.”

The Parker Solar Probe's upcoming flyby on December 24 is expected to yield groundbreaking data about solar phenomena that could protect Earth’s technologies from solar-induced disruptions.
newTitle: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe to Make Historic Flyby of the Sun’s Corona on Christmas Eve

title: Vinod Kambli's Health Deteriorates, Admitted To Hospital. Report Says Condition Stable But... - NDTV Sports
summary:
Vinod Kambli's Health Deteriorates, Admitted To Hospital

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: IANS

Former Indian cricket star Vinod Kambli has been hospitalized due to a serious health issue. Though his condition is reported to be stable, it remains critical. Kambli's recent public appearances have sparked concerns over his health.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akriti Hospital in Thane after his health deteriorated.
  • His condition is stable but remains critical according to reports.
  • He communicated with fans via social media, giving a thumbs-up to show he is improving.
  • Kambli revealed he has been battling a urine infection and has received support from his family and friends.
  • He expressed gratitude towards his wife and children for their support during his recovery.
"I am better now. My wife takes care of me a lot. She took me to 3 different hospitals and told me 'You have to get fit'." - Vinod Kambli

Kambli's struggles highlight the importance of health and family support in recovery. Fans and former teammates are rallying behind him during this challenging time.
newTitle: Vinod Kambli's Health Deteriorates, Admitted To Hospital

title: Sheikh Hasina extradition: Bangladesh sends note verbale asking India to send back deposed PM - The Hindu
summary:
Bangladesh Requests Extradition of Deposed PM Sheikh Hasina from India

Published: December 23, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Bangladesh's interim government has requested the extradition of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina from India, where she has been living in exile since fleeing the country amid protests.

  • Sheikh Hasina fled to India on August 5, 2024, amid student-led protests that deposed her.
  • Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal has issued arrest warrants against Hasina for crimes against humanity.
  • The interim government has sent a diplomatic note to India requesting her return for judicial proceedings.
  • An existing extradition treaty between Bangladesh and India could facilitate the process.
“Bangladesh wants her back here for the judicial process,” Foreign Affairs Adviser Touhid Hossain said.

In conclusion, Bangladesh is actively pursuing the legal return of Sheikh Hasina to face serious charges stemming from her time in office.
newTitle: Bangladesh Requests Extradition of Deposed PM Sheikh Hasina from India
